TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They were represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

In DATE ORG ( Rat der PERSON ) granted the applicants permission to build a house on QUANTITY of public land . On DATE the house - owners’ right of use ( dingliches Nutzungsrecht ) was registered in the land register .
On DATE the applicants requested the sale of the property by GPE ( “ GPE ) in accordance with LAW ( Volkskammer ) on ORG .
On DATE the City was registered as the owner of the land in the land register .

On DATE the City and the applicants agreed on the terms of the sale of the property before a notary public . The parties agreed on the purchase price of MONEY ( DEM DATE ( ORG ) ) , corresponding to the value of the land ( Bodenwert ) in DATE , in accordance with the GPE ’s practice regarding requests for sale made prior to CARDINAL DATE by those who had legally built their houses on public land . The value of the land was estimated at ORG ( ORG ) in DATE .

The sale could only take effect once approved by the supervisory administrative body , as required by LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” below ) , and on DATE the ORG requested that the sale be approved by ORG , represented by ORG ( Regierungspräsidium GPE – “ the ORG ” ) . On DATE the City informed ORG that the difference between the purchase price and the value of the land would not be accounted for in the GPE ’s budget . On DATE ORG refused to approve the sale . ORG noted that a municipality was entitled to sell land below the market price in order to further the acquisition of private property in accordance with LAW ) , point ( CARDINAL ) , of LAW ( Sächsische Gemeindeordnung – see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” below ) , but , referring to a decree of ORG of DATE , found that a sale in the present case would have an adverse effect on the municipal budget .
On DATE ORG dismissed an objection by the applicants .

On DATE ORG ( Verwaltungsgericht ) ordered that the sale of the property be approved , noting that in accordance with LAW ) , point ( CARDINAL ) , of FAC taken in conjunction with section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and section CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Sachenrechtsbereinigungsgesetz – see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” below ) , the sale price should be set at CARDINAL the value of the land but reasonable reductions might be granted in appropriate circumstances .

On DATE the ORG ( Oberverwaltungsgericht ) reversed that decision and dismissed the ORG claim , holding that the refusal to approve the sale had been lawful as the conditions of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , point ( CARDINAL ) , of FAC had not been met . The applicants had no right to have the sale approved in view of ORG approval of similar sales prior to the decree of CARDINAL DATE ; only prior lawful administrative actions could give rise to a right to be treated alike , not approvals of contracts in violation of section CARDINAL of GPE . The court noted that the applicants could either buy the property for CARDINAL of the value of the land or reach an agreement with the City on another reasonable reduction of the purchase price ; therefore the core of their property rights had not been impaired .
On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal on points of law because the matter was not of fundamental importance and the lower courts had not committed procedural errors .
On DATE ORG refused to accept the ORG constitutional complaint for examination ORG ( no . CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
Section CARDINAL of GPE provides , inter alia :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A municipality may sell assets if it does not need the assets to fulfil its obligations and if the sale does not conflict with the interests of general welfare . Assets shall be sold for their full value . The municipality may grant reasonable reductions on the purchase price of freehold apartments and real property on the basis of social considerations to further the acquisition of private property .
( CARDINAL ) Legal transactions by which the municipality undertakes
CARDINAL . NORP to sell real property or similar rights ... require the approval of the supervisory administrative body . ”
Section CARDINAL of GPE provides that legal transactions that require approval have no legal effect until approved ; if the approval is refused , the legal transactions are void ab initio .

Section CARDINAL of LAW provides , inter alia , that the owner of a house that has been legally built on public property may sue the owner of the land with a view to obtaining acceptance of an offer to purchase it . Section CARDINAL ) of LAW provides that the purchase price must be CARDINAL of the value of the land .

Sections CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL)(a ) of the LAW on the Identification of the Allocation of Former Public Property provide that municipalities may sell real property that is still listed as public property in the land register without it being subject to restrictions on the sale of municipal real property .
